data.title: Yearly & Monthly weather
data.meta_description: Djelfa, Algeria - Climate and weather forecast by month. Detailed climate information with charts - average monthly weather with temperature, pressure, humidity, precipitation, wind, daylight, sunshine, visibility, and UV index data. July is the warmest month of the year in Djelfa, Algeria, registering average temperatures as high as 34.9°C (94.8°F) and as low as 23.8°C (74.8°F). Captivated in the landscape of a North African desert region, Djelfa weathers fluctuating temperatures, variable rainfall patterns, and a fierce amount of sunlight throughout the year.
data.text:
Average temperature

Djelfa, Algeria

The warmest month (with the highest average high temperature) is July (34.9°C).

The month with the lowest average high temperature is January (10.3°C).

The month with the highest average low temperature is July (23.8°C).

The coldest month (with the lowest average low temperature) is January (2.8°C).

Average snowfall

Djelfa, Algeria

The month with the highest snowfall is January (16mm).

The months with the least snowfall are May, June, July, August, September and October (0mm).

Average snowfall days

Djelfa, Algeria

The month with the highest number of snowfall days is January (2.8 days).

The months with the least snowfall days are May, June, July, August, September and October (0 days).

Average daylight / Average sunshine

Djelfa, Algeria

The month with the longest days is June (Average daylight: 14h and 24min).

The month with the shortest days is December (Average daylight: 9h and 54min).

The months with the most sunshine are June and July (Average sunshine: 12h and 0min).

The month with the least sunshine is December (Average sunshine: 6h and 48min).

Average UV index

Djelfa, Algeria

The month with the highest UV index is July (UV index 8).

The months with the lowest UV index are January, February, November and December (UV index 3).

Average visibility

Djelfa, Algeria

The months with the highest visibility are February, March, April, May, June, July, August, September, October, November and December (10km).

The month with the lowest visibility is January (9km).
